DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Comment ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of applying, dispensing or otherwise giving medications or other substances to experimental units. EXAMPLE(S): An experimental unit who receives methotrexate as part of chemotherapy, radiation therapy. For a SubstanceAdministration, targetAnatomicSiteCode = "coronary artery", approachAnatomicSiteCode = "groin", routeOfAdministrationCode = "intra-arterial". Additional description of the activity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Comment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A written explanation or criticism or illustration that is added to a book or other textual material.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A written explanation or criticism or illustration that is added to a book or other textual material.

Concepts.definition: A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Character string datatype stands for text data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/13 Added AIM Foundation Model CSI reference. jc
